name: maprotiline
source: Bergstrom C. A. S.; Norinder U.; Luthman K.; Artursson P. Molecular Descriptors Influencing Melting Point and Their Role in Classification of Solid Drugs. J. Chem. Inf. Comput. Sci.; (Article); 2003; 43(4); 1177-1404
Reason: The compound maprotiline has a complex structure with multiple functional groups that affect its melting point. The base unit, a phenyl group, has a melting point of approximately 80°C. The addition of a nitro group increases the melting point by approximately +20°C due to increased polarity and potential for hydrogen bonding. The presence of a methyl group adds +10°C due to increased van der Waals forces. The tert-butyl group contributes +40°C due to increased bulkiness and steric hindrance. The phenyl ring in the 3-position has a higher melting point than a simple phenyl group due to increased conjugation and potential for hydrogen bonding. The methyl group in the 4-position reduces the melting point slightly due to increased flexibility. The overall effect of the functional groups on the melting point is approximately +100°C.
